CLUES - Reflecting on your work

CLUE is built to help you reuse and extend everything in a tool tile. You have seen how you can pull in tiles from the curriculum, and from your group mates when you are collaborating. You can also do this with your own work. If you flip to the Class Work tab you'll be able to sort by Name and find your own documents, as well as those of others in your class. These will open up in the left resources pane. Change the Show for choice to unit or All and you'll see all the work you have done so far. This is handy for reusing solution methods you've already developed, or for reflecting on ways you went about things. You'll be able to see the past work of your peers as well, as long as they shared their work. Comparing and contrasting methods is a great way to learn.

Categorizing your Work

The Class Work view lets you sort documents in several important ways. You can look at work by by Group (to see differences in how each group is developing ideas), by Tools used, and by Learning Strategy. The strategy sort will help you see over time the way you approach your work and how your classmates do it. If your work isn't being sorted into a strategy yet, try the Ideas? button. Our AI agent, Ada Insight, will give you some hints on how to take your learning further. We encourage you to consider whether you agree with Ada, and to record your thoughts about your reasoning. This is another form of work reflection and it will help you become a star learner.

Comments and History

Ada uses Comments to return feedback and categorization. (Different CLUE units each have their own categories depending on the subject.) You, your peers, and your teacher can also make comments on each other's work, and look at how your work has evolved over time. Open up the Comments panel by clicking the chat bubble icon at the top of the Resources pane. Select the tile or workspace you want to comment on and let the discussion begin!

It can also help to see how work evolved. Use the history controls at the bottom of workspace views to move back and forth in time.
